Founder of the Chola Empire

Vijayalaya Chola is considered the founder of the medieval 'Imperial Cholas' dynasty. In the mid-9th century, when the Pallavas and Pandyas were fighting each other, Vijayalaya took advantage of this opportunity and captured Thanjavur (Tanjore) from the Muttaraiyar chieftains in 850 CE.

ЁЯП░
Capital and Architecture

He made Thanjavur his capital and built a temple for his family deity 'Nishumbhasudini' (Durga) there. This marked the resurgence of Chola power, which originated from the Kaveri Delta region and spread throughout South India and Southeast Asia.
